level.text: Any person who violates any provision of this subchapter shall, upon conviction, be subject to imprisonment not to exceed one year, a fine not to exceed $10,000, or both.
Any person who has been previously convicted under this subchapter shall, upon conviction, be subject to imprisonment not to exceed one year, a fine not to exceed $25,000, or both.
The fines set forth in this section shall not be limited by [§ 22-3571.01].

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-317 added (c).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 112(f) of the Criminal Fine Proportionality Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-45, April 1, 2013, 60 DCR 5400, 20 DCSTAT 1300).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-261
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 12-261, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 47-2801.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Applicability of D.C. Law 19-317: Section 401 of D.C. Law 19-317 provided that the act shall apply only to offenses committed on or after June 11, 2013.
